        public java.util.Set<RoomColor> getRooms()

      • getSquareById

        public Square getSquareById​(int id)
        Gets square by id if exists, otherwise throw exception
        Parameters:
        id -
        Returns:
        the square with the given id. It is unique and never null
        Throws:
        SquareNotInMapException - if there is not a square in this map with the given Id

      • getSpawnPoints

        public java.util.Set<SpawnPoint> getSpawnPoints()
        Get a set of all the spawnpoints on the map
        Returns:
        a set containing all the spawnpoints of the map

      • spawnPlayer

        public void spawnPlayer​(Player player,
                        SpawnPoint spawnPoint)
        Spawns player on a spawnpoint if it is not already on the map. this also calls player.setMap(this) so it modifies the player
        Parameters:
        player - the player to spawn
        spawnPoint - the spawnpoint on which the player will spawn
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if player is null or spawnPoint is null
        SquareNotInMapException - if square is not in this map
        PlayerAlreadyOnMapException - if this map already has this player

      • movePlayer

        public void movePlayer​(Player player,
                       Square square)
        Move player to a square in the map
        Parameters:
        player -
        square -
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if one of the params is null
        PlayerNotOnMapException - if player is not on map
        SquareNotInMapException - if map does not have this square

      • removePlayer

        public void removePlayer​(Player player)
        Removes player from map
        Parameters:
        player -
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if player is null
        PlayerNotOnMapException - if player is not on this map

        public void checkPlayerInMap​(Player player)
        Check if player is in map
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if player is null

      • getAllSquaresAtExactDistance

        public java.util.Set<Square> getAllSquaresAtExactDistance​(Square from,
                                                          int distance)
        Get all squares at distance strictly equal to "distance", not less nor more
        Parameters:
        from - the square from which to start calculating distances
        distance - the exact distance
        Returns:
        a set containing all the squares at that distance
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if 'from' is null
        SquareNotInMapException - if square is not in map
        NegativeException - if distance is < 0

      • getAllSquaresAtDistanceLessThanOrEquals

        public java.util.Set<Square> getAllSquaresAtDistanceLessThanOrEquals​(Square from,
                                                                     int distance)
        Get all squares at distance less than or equal to distance, including the starting square
        Parameters:
        from - the square from which to start calculating distances
        distance - the maximum distance
        Returns:
        a set containing all the squares at distance less than or equal to distance, including the starting square
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if 'from' is null
        SquareNotInMapException - if square is not in map
        NegativeException - if distance is < 0

      • getAllSquaresInRoom

        public java.util.Set<Square> getAllSquaresInRoom​(RoomColor color)
        Gets all the squares in the same room of the given square, including the square given
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the room
        Returns:
        a set containing all the sets of that room. It cannot be empty
        Throws:
        RoomNotInMapException - if there is not a square with this color in this map

      • getAllVisibleSquares

        public java.util.Set<Square> getAllVisibleSquares​(Square from)
        Gets all the squares visible from the given square according to the game rules: all the squares in the room and all the squares in the rooms that are connected through doors on the given square, if any
        Parameters:
        from - the square from which you are getting the other squares
        Returns:
        a set with all the visible squares
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if "from" is null
        SquareNotInMapException - if "from" is not in map

      • getPlayersOnSquare

        public java.util.Set<Player> getPlayersOnSquare​(Square square)
        Get all the players on a given square
        Parameters:
        square - the square on which the players are
        Returns:
        a set of players that can be empty if there are no players on the square
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if square is null
        SquareNotInMapException - if map does not have this square

      • getPlayerPosition

        public Square getPlayerPosition​(Player player)
        Get the square containing that player or null if the player is not on the map
        Returns:
        the square on which that player lays
        Throws:
        PlayerNotOnMapException - if the player is not on the map

      • getAllPlayers

        public java.util.Set<Player> getAllPlayers()
        get all players on map
        Returns:
        a set containing all players on map

      • hasPlayer

        public boolean hasPlayer​(Player player)
        checks if map has a player
        Parameters:
        player - the player being checked
        Returns:
        true if the player is actually on the map

      • getPlayersNumber

        public int getPlayersNumber()
        return the number of players on the map
        Returns:
        an integer representing the number of players on the map

      • getAllSquares

        public java.util.Set<Square> getAllSquares()
        A set of all the squares of the map, without any order
        Returns:
        A set of all the squares of the map, without any order

      • getSquaresToRefill

        public java.util.Set<Square> getSquaresToRefill()
        Returns:
        all the ammo points that have no ammo cards and all the spawnpoints with less than 3 weapons

      • getAllSquaresByCardinal

        public java.util.List<Square> getAllSquaresByCardinal​(Square from,
                                                      CardinalDirection direction,
                                                      boolean stopOnWalls)
        Returns in a list all squares in a given cardinal direction until the end of the map, stop on walls if throughWalls=false
        Parameters:
        from - the starting square, will return as the first element of the list
        direction - the cardinal direction
        Returns:
        a List containing the squares in the order in which they are walked in the path
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if one of the params is null
        SquareNotInMapException - if map does not have that square

      • getAllSquaresByCardinal

        public java.util.List<Square> getAllSquaresByCardinal​(Square from,
                                                      CardinalDirection direction)
        Returns in a list all squares in a given cardinal direction until the end of the map. Does not stop on walls
        Parameters:
        from - the starting square, will return as the first element of the list
        direction - the cardinal direction
        Returns:
        a List containing the squares in the order in which they are walked in the path
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if one of the params is null
        SquareNotInMapException - if map does not have that square

      • getPlayersInDirection

        public java.util.Set<Player> getPlayersInDirection​(Square from,
                                                   CardinalDirection direction)
        Gets all players in a cardinal direction, passing through walls. Does not return them in order
        Parameters:
        from - the square from which the research start
        direction -
        Returns:
        a set of the players in the direction, including the players on the "from" square, if any. The set could be empty. If order is needed, use getAllSquaresByCardinal method
        Throws:
        SquareNotInMapException - if "from" square is not in map
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if one of the params is null

      • getVisiblePlayers

        public java.util.Set<Player> getVisiblePlayers​(Square from)
        Get all visible players from a given square
        Parameters:
        from - Square
        Returns:
        All visible players from the given square
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if "from" is null
        SquareNotInMapException - if the map does not have this square

      • getDirection

        public CardinalDirection getDirection​(Square from,
                                      Square to)
        Given 2 aligned squares, calculates the direction that you have to take to go from the square "from" to the square "to". Works through walls too
        Parameters:
        from -
        to -
        Throws:
        NoDirectionException - if from=to or from and to are not aligned

      • getSquareByCoordinate

        public Square getSquareByCoordinate​(int x,
                                    int y)
        Given as hypothesis that a top left square exists and has id 0, returns the square with the given coordinates having the point (0, 0) in the top left square
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate (left to right)
        y - the y coordinate (top to bottom)
        Returns:
        a square if the coordinates are inside the map, null otherwise
